newsitem.title: CANADA: CWB drops August 96/97 wheat, feed barley PROs.
newsitem.headline: CWB drops August 96/97 wheat, feed barley PROs.

text.p: The Canadian Wheat Board said it dropped its August Pool Return Outlook wheat and feed barley price forecast for the 1996/97 (August/July) crop year by $13 and $4 each on promising output, a CWB statement said.
The PROs are a monthly Board estimate of world prices but not connected to CWB initial payments to farmers, which was announced July 29 and took effect August 1, 1996.
Benchmark No1 Canada Western Red Spring Wheat PROs dropped to $232-252 range from the $245-265 range in July.
No1 Canada Western Feed Barley fell to $157-177 from $161-181 range in July.
Special select Canada Western Two-Row Malting Barley prices rose to the $230-250 range from July's $226-246.
Durum wheat and six-row malt barley remained unchanged.

The CWB said wheat prices dropped on improved wheat output prospects in several major exporting and importing regions. Recent indications were that China's import demand was lower, while active U.S. farmer selling weighed on futures prices.
Production prospects in the European Union and most Southern Hemisphere nations were favourable. As prices fall, buyers delayed buying despite forecast of tight ending stocks.
An expected record Prairie barley crop weighed on prices.
A significant rise in global feed grain supplies also pressured feed barley values. Total world barley production was estimated to be significantly higher than last year.
Continued demand for two-row malt barley supported the August PRO. That price depends on western Canadian and Australian barley quantity and quality which will be determined in the coming months.
Pool returns in Canadian dollars per tonne based on grain in store St. Lawrence or Vancouver:
CWRS=Canada Western Spring Wheat. CPSR=Canada Prairie Spring Red. CPSW=Canada Prairie Spring White. CWRW= Canada Western Red Winter. CWES=Canada Western Extra Strong.
CWSWS=Canada Western Soft White Spring. CWF=Canada Western Feed. CWAD=Canada Western Amber Durum. CW=Canada Western.
